intro: Senecio leiocarpus, commonly known as the white-fruit senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its most distinctive feature is the white, fleshy fruits that resemble small, rounded pods. Senecio leiocarpus is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
